PATIENT_ID: TEST_PELVIC_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-20 08:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-20 08:10:00
Category I activation for 42-year-old male. Pedestrian struck at high speed.
Pelvic fracture suspected on exam. Pelvic ring injury concern.
BP 72/42, HR 145, RR 30, GCS 14.
Hemodynamic instability documented. Hypotension refractory to fluids.
Pelvic hemorrhage suspected source of shock.
FAST positive for free fluid.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-20 08:25:00
Pelvic x-ray: pubic symphysis diastasis 3.5 cm.
Unstable pelvic ring pattern confirmed.
CT pelvis: bilateral sacroiliac joint widening >1 cm.
Sacroiliac joint fracture-dislocation on right.
Sacral fracture displaced. Pelvic CT confirms instability.
No gross hematuria. No urologic injury identified on CT.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-20 08:15:00
Pelvic binder applied immediately upon arrival.
Binder applied within 5 minutes of recognition of instability.
Massive transfusion protocol activated.

[OPERATIVE_NOTE] 2026-02-20 09:00:00
Emergent angioembolization performed by interventional radiology.
External fixation planned for definitive stabilization.
Orthopedic surgery consulted and present in trauma bay.
